verses.verse: (Assurance of Zion’s Salvation) For Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, And for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, Until her righteousness goes forth as brightness, And her salvation as a lamp that burns.

(Is. 60:3) The Gentiles shall see your righteousness, And all (Ps. 102:15, 16; 138:4, 5; 148:11, 13) kings your glory. (Is. 62:4, 12; 65:15) You shall be called by a new name, Which the mouth of the LORD will name.
You shall also be (Is. 28:5; Zech. 9:16; 1 Thess. 2:19) a crown of glory In the hand of the LORD, And a royal diadem In the hand of your God.

(Hos. 1:10; 1 Pet. 2:10) You shall no longer be termed (Is. 49:14; 54:6, 7) Forsaken, Nor shall your land any more be termed (Is. 54:1) Desolate; But you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; For the LORD delights in you, And your land shall be married.
For as a young man marries a virgin, So shall your sons marry you; And as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, (Is. 65:19) So shall your God rejoice over you.
(Is. 52:8; Jer. 6:17; Ezek. 3:17; 33:7) I have set watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem; They shall never hold their peace day or night. You who make mention of the LORD, do not keep silent,
And give Him no rest till He establishes And till He makes Jerusalem (Is. 60:18; 61:11; Jer. 33:9; Zeph. 3:19, 20) a praise in the earth.

The LORD has sworn by His right hand And by the arm of His strength: “Surely I will no longer (Lev. 26:16; Deut. 28:31, 33; Judg. 6:3-6; Is. 1:7; Jer. 5:17) give your grain As food for your enemies; And the sons of the foreigner shall not drink your new wine, For which you have labored.
But those who have gathered it shall eat it, And praise the LORD; Those who have brought it together shall drink it (Deut. 12:12; 14:23, 26) in My holy courts.”
Go through, Go through the gates! (Is. 40:3; 57:14) Prepare the way for the people; Build up, Build up the highway! Take out the stones, (Is. 11:12) Lift up a banner for the peoples!

Indeed the LORD has proclaimed To the end of the world: (Zech. 9:9; Matt. 21:5; John 12:15) “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Surely your salvation is coming; Behold, His (Is. 40:10; (Rev. 22:12)) reward is with Him, And His work before Him.’ ”
And they shall call them The Holy People, The Redeemed of the LORD; And you shall be called Sought Out, A City Not Forsaken.
